revision.text:
{{Infobox comedian |name = Natasha Leggero |image =Natasha Leggero.jpg |caption = Natasha Leggero at ComicCon on July 2014. |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1974|03|26}} |birth_place = [[Rockford, Illinois|Rockford]], [[Illinois]], U.S |active = 2000–present |medium = Stand-up, television, film |alma_mater=[[Stella Adler Studio of Acting|Stella Adler Conservatory]]
[[Hunter College]] |genre = [[Observational comedy]], [[blue comedy]], [[insult comedy]], [[satire]] |subject= [[Social class]], [[celebrity culture]] |spouse= {{marriage|[[Moshe Kasher]]|2015}} |children = 1 |website = {{url|http://natashaleggero.com}} }} '''Natasha Leggero''' (born March 26, 1974) is an American actress, comedian, and writer. She rose to fame after appearing as the host of ''[[MTV's The 70s House]]'' (2005), and for her tenure as a regular roundtable panelist on [[Chelsea Handler]]'s late-night talk show ''[[Chelsea Lately]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.tv.com/chelsea-lately/show/74584/episode.html/|title=Chelsea Lately|website=[[TV.com]]|publisher=[[E!]]|accessdate=April 7, 2009}} Her comedy, characterized as [[observational humor|observational]], has been noted by critics for its use of [[satire]] as commentary on such themes as celebrity culture and class. Her stand-up television appearances include performances on ''[[The Tonight Show with Jay Leno]]'', ''[[The Late Late Show (CBS TV series)|The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson]]'', ''[[Last Call with Carson Daly]]'', ''[[The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon]]'' and she has appeared on multiple [[Comedy Central]] stand-up programs as well as their animated show ''[[Ugly Americans (TV series)|Ugly Americans]]'', wherein she voiced Callie Maggotbone. In 2015, she co-created the period sitcom ''[[Another Period]]'' for Comedy Central, in which she stars alongside co-creator [[Riki Lindhome]]. ==Early life== Leggero was born March 26, 1974{{efn|A June 2017 profile in ''Forbes'' notes that Leggero is 43 years old. On March 26, 2017, Leggero re-tweeted a "Happy Birthday" wish directed at her from Showtime Networks, which was posted the same day.{{cite tweet |last= Leggero |first=Natasha |user=natashaleggero |number=846044941826473984 |date=March 26, 2017|title=Thank you! Season 2 coming soon! |access-date=October 7, 2017 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20171007042243/https://twitter.com/natashaleggero/status/846044941826473984 |archive-date=October 7, 2017 |dead-url=no}} Her birthdate of March 26 is corroborated by public records available through [http://familysearch.org FamilySearch]."United States Public Records, 1970-2009," database, [https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:KVKG-FQX FamilySearch] (22 May 2014), Natasha T Leggero, Residence, Los Angeles, California, United States; a third party aggregator of publicly available information.}} in [[Rockford, Illinois]]{{cite web|url=http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/natasha-leggero/bio/196902 |title=Natasha Leggero Biography|work=TV Guide|accessdate=October 7, 2017}} and is of [[Italians|Italian]]{{cite interview|url=https://gpodder.net/podcast/the-adam-carolla-show-1/adam-carolla-show-natasha-leggero-1|work= The Adam Carolla Show|title=Natasha Leggero| date=June 16, 2010|accessdate=December 28, 2016|first=Natasha|last=Leggero}} and [[Swedish people|Swedish]]{{cite interview|first=Natasha|last=Leggero|work=The Artie Lange Show|title=Natasha Leggero and Moshe Kasher|interviewer=[[Artie Lange]]|date=November 13, 2013}} {{Youtube|bB5kOi_Bcqk}}. descent. She has stated that a [[Genetic testing|DNA test]] revealed 6% [[Sub-Saharan Africa]]n ancestry.{{cite web|url=http://www.cc.com/video-clips/ibyy9i/the-nightly-show-panel---rachel-dolezal---defining-blackness |title=The Nightly Show|website=[[cc.com]]|publisher=[[Comedy Central]]|accessdate=June 17, 2015}} Leggero was raised [[Roman Catholic]]{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9n4v9PBKXZg|title=Joe Rogan Experience #653|date=May 27, 2015|accessdate=December 30, 2015|work=YouTube}} but converted to [[Judaism]] as an adult.{{cite news|last= |first= |title=‘Abortions cool’ in Judaism, says newly Jewish comedian|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/abortions-cool-in-judaism-says-newly-jewish-comedian/|work=[[The Times of Israel]]|date=June 2, 2016|accessdate=June 2, 2016}} Commenting on her childhood, she stated: "I would say [we were] lower-middle-class, but I feel like my mom would start crying if she heard that. But my dad was a used car dealer and my mother worked in a locksmith shop as the bookkeeper, and then they got divorced, and I do remember, like, nuns bringing us food—like big canned goods. And then, you know, we didn't really go on vacation–ever... I had so many jobs growing up: I mowed lawns; I worked at a grocery store; I had two newspaper routes; I worked at a catering place... I definitely hustled."{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/russespinoza/2017/06/15/predatory-lending-may-be-responsible-for-natasha-leggeros-career/#5b9919a3e53f|work=Forbes|title=Frustrated To Fabulous: The Humble Beginnings Of Natasha Leggero|author=Espionza, Russ|date=June 15, 2017|accessdate=June 28, 2017}} She began performing at age 10, in plays in [[Chicago]]. Leggero attended [[Rockford East High School]],{{cite web|url=http://www.rrstar.com/article/20150825/NEWS/150829668/?Start=1 |title=Kevin Haas: Rockford East grad Natasha Leggero revives 9-year-old Taco Bell vote in comedy special |publisher=rrstar.com |date=August 25, 2015 |accessdate=October 3, 2015 }} and worked at a [[grocery store]] as a teenager.{{cite interview|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pBQhK972Pu8|work=WTF Podcast|author=Maron, Marc|interviewer=Natasha Leggero|date=May 16, 2016|accessdate=October 22, 2016|title=WTF Podcast with Marc Maron #707}} After graduating from high school, Leggero attended [[Illinois State University]], where she studied for two years and spent a semester studying abroad in [[England]]. While at Illinois State, Leggero auditioned for the [[Stella Adler Studio of Acting|Stella Adler Conservatory]] in Chicago, and was accepted into the theater program. She then relocated to New York City to attend the conservatory, spending two years studying. In 1996, she moved to [[Sydney, Australia]] with her then-boyfriend, and lived there for a year before returning to New York{{Cite web|url=http://www.cbs.com/shows/the-late-show-with-stephen-colbert/video/F3189F7B-57AA-7E4A-9F80-704214310195/natasha-leggero-once-worked-the-phones-at-an-australian-brothel/|title=Late Show with Stephen Colbert|last=|first=|date=20 Jun 2016|website=|publisher=|access-date=27 Jun 2016}} to attend [[Hunter College]], where she graduated in 2000 with a [[B.A.]] in [[Theater critic]]ism. She relocated to [[Los Angeles]] shortly before the [[September 11 attacks]]. ==Career== Leggero shot an unaired pilot called ''The Strip'' for [[NBC]], with [[Tom Lennon]] and [[Ben Garant]] from ''[[Reno 911!]]''. Alongside [[Andy Kindler]] and [[Greg Giraldo]], she was a judge on the 2010 season of NBC's ''[[Last Comic Standing]]'', hosted by [[Craig Robinson (actor)|Craig Robinson]].{{cite web|url=http://aspecialthing.com/forum/f27/pilot-season-2010-2011-a-16080/index2.html/|title=Pilot Season 2010-2011|accessdate=June 6, 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100223112211/http://aspecialthing.com/forum/f27/pilot-season-2010-2011-a-16080/index2.html|archivedate=February 23, 2010|deadurl=yes|df=}} Leggero played Emma in NBC's 2011 sitcom ''[[Free Agents (U.S. TV series)|Free Agents]]''. From 2010 to January 2012, Leggero co-hosted ''[http://lavenderhour.com/ The Lavender Hour]'' podcast with comedian [[Duncan Trussell]]. From 2010 to 2012, she voiced the role of Callie Maggotbone on the animated series ''[[Ugly Americans (TV series)|Ugly Americans]]''.{{cite web|work=LA Weekly|url=http://www.laweekly.com/arts/natasha-leggero-on-ugly-americans-voice-acting-and-what-its-like-being-cast-as-domineering-bitches-2372849|date=March 22, 2012|author=Ohanesian, Liz|title=Natasha Leggero on Ugly Americans Voice Acting and What It's Like Being 'Cast as Domineering Bitches'|accessdate=October 5, 2017}} In 2012, she also appeared in six episodes of NBC's ''[[Are You There, Chelsea?]]'' as Nikki, who was Rick's (the bar manager's) ex-girlfriend. Leggero was featured in every first-season episode starting with the second episode, "Sloane's Ex."{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/01/19/are-you-there-chelsea-natasha-leggero-ricks-ex-video_n_1215311.html|work=[[The Huffington Post]]|first=Jason|last=Hughes|title=Natasha Leggero Plays Rick's Rude Ex On 'Are You There, Chelsea?'|date=January 19, 2012}} She also played the sex-obsessed Haley in the web series ''[[Burning Love (web series)|Burning Love]]'', a spoof of the TV series ''[[The Bachelor (U.S. TV series)|The Bachelor]]'' and ''[[The Bachelorette]]''. In 2013, Leggero appeared in an episode of the ''[[Drunk History]]'' television series on [[Comedy Central]]. On September 2, 2013, Leggero participated in the [[Comedy Central Roast]] of [[James Franco]] as one of the Roasters; the following day, ''[[Brickleberry]]'' premiered in its second season. Leggero voiced the busty ranger Ethel in place of [[Kaitlin Olson]], who was in the first season only. ''Tubbin' with Tash'' debuted on October 2, 2013 on Leggero's [[YouTube]] channel. The premise of the show is Leggero interviewing guests while in a hot tub.[https://www.youtube.com/user/NatashaLeggeroBUH Natasha Leggero]. YouTube. Retrieved on June 5, 2014. In August 2015, she debuted her Comedy Central standup special, ''Live at Bimbo's'' (originally entitled ''Diamond Pussy''), which she filmed in San Francisco.{{cite web|work=The Comic's Comic|url=http://thecomicscomic.com/2015/08/22/natasha-leggero-live-at-bimbos-comedy-central/||title=Natasha Leggero: 'Live at Bimbo's'|date=August 22, 2015|author=McCarthy, Sean L.|accessdate=October 6, 2017}} In 2015, Leggero and [[Riki Lindhome]] created the [[Comedy Central]] series ''[[Another Period]]'', which they also star in together; the series premiered June 23, 2015, and was renewed for a second season, which premiered June 15, 2016. On May 23, 2016, it was renewed for a third season{{Cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2016/05/another-period-renewed-third-season-comedy-central-promo-1201761247/|title=‘Another Period’ Renewed For Third Season By Comedy Central|last=Petski|first=Denise|date=2016-05-23|language=en-US|access-date=2016-07-27}}, which will air in 2018.{{cite tweet |author-link=Natasha Leggero |user=natashaleggero |number=902234878070087680 |date=28 August 2017 |title=Another Period S3 coming 2018! |language=English}} In 2016 and 2017, Leggero and husband Moshe Kasher embarked on ''The Honeymoon Tour'', in which they performed standup shows and provided humorous relationship advice throughout the United States.{{cite web|work=Gambit|url=https://www.bestofneworleans.com/thelatest/archives/2017/07/13/moshe-kasher-and-natasha-leggero-perform-at-one-eyed-jacks-july-19|date=July 13, 2017|title=Moshe Kasher and Natasha Leggero perform at One Eyed Jacks July 19|author=Coviello, Will|accessdate=October 7, 2017}} ===New Year's Eve incident=== On December 31, 2013, Leggero was criticized for a joke she made during NBC's ''[[New Year's Eve with Carson Daly]]'', when, in response to a controversial [[Twitter|tweet]] posted by [[SpaghettiOs]] on the anniversary of the [[Attack on Pearl Harbor|Pearl Harbor attack]], she quipped: "It sucks that the only survivors of Pearl Harbor are being mocked by the only food they can still chew." Her remarks were met with a backlash over social media; in response, Leggero posted in a blog entry that she did not feel that "the amazing courage of American veterans and specifically those who survived Pearl Harbor is in any way diminished by a comedian making a joke about [[dentures]] on television. Do we really believe that the people who fought and defended our freedom against [[Nazi]]s and the [[Axis powers]] will find a joke about Spaghetti O's too much to bear? Sorry, I have more respect for Veterans than to think their honor can be impugned by a glamorous, charming comedian in a fur hat." She also called on those offended by the remarks to donate to [[Disabled American Veterans]].{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/entertainment/tv/tv-highlights-networks-compete-for-most-entertaining-new-years-show/2013/12/30/3826f0fa-715a-11e3-8def-a33011492df2_story.html|author=Rachel Lubitz|title=TV highlights: Networks compete for most entertaining New Year’s show|work=[[The Washington Post]]|accessdate=January 6, 2014|date=December 30, 2013}}{{cite news|author=Margaret Eby|title=Comedian Natasha Leggero responds to controversy over World War II veteran joke: 'I'm not sorry|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv-movies/comedian-natasha-leggero-responds-controversy-world-war-ii-veteran-joke-article-1.1566225|work=[[Daily News (New York)|New York Daily News]]|date=January 4, 2014|accessdate=January 6, 2014}}{{cite web|author=Drew Grant|title=Comedian Natasha Leggero is Sorry/Not-Sorry About SpaghettiO-Gate|url=http://observer.com/2014/01/comedian-natasha-leggero-is-sorrynot-sorry-about-spaghettio-gate/|work=[[The New York Observer]]|accessdate=January 6, 2014}} ==Comedic style== Leggero's comedy has been characterized as [[observational comedy|observational]],{{cite web|work=Westword|url=http://www.westword.com/arts/the-ten-best-comedy-shows-in-april-5812679|title=The ten best comedy shows in April|accessdate=October 4, 2017|author=Hesse, Josiah M.|date=March 29, 2013}} with frequent commentary on [[celebrity]] culture and class. Her approach to standup has been noted for its heavy use of [[persona]], which largely relies on costumes and "an air of mock-refinement and elitism." Journalist John Wenzel wrote that Leggero's use of persona "[allows her to] indict the most bloated, superficial aspects of our culture."{{cite web|author=Wenzel, John|work=The Know|title=Why So Serious, Natasha Leggero?|date=November 15, 2010|accessdate=August 30, 2017}} Maggie Lange of ''[[GQ]]'' noted:
All performers have a character to some extent, but Leggero is one of the few with a costume. She’s like a wolf in sheep’s clothing, but like a seasoned comedian in socialite’s clothing. She’s always been this way. Who is the most formally dressed being at every ''Roast''? Natasha Leggero. Who is perhaps the only person to have ever worn long white gloves to the [[Laugh Factory]]? Natasha Leggero. It’s always like she’s going to another party. While other comedians are trying to out-casual each other, she’s sitting with impeccable posture, dripping diamonds, dripping disdain.{{cite web|work=[[GQ]]|title=Nobody in Comedy Commits Like Natasha Leggero|author=Lange, Maggie|url=https://www.gq.com/story/nobody-commits-like-natasha-leggero|date=August 21, 2015|accessdate=December 23, 2016}}
==Personal life== Between 2011 and 2012, Leggero dated comedian [[Duncan Trussell]], with whom she co-hosted the podcast, ''The Lavender Hour''.{{cite web|url=https://www.spin.com/2011/10/dressed-kill-day-life-rising-comedienne-natasha-leggero/|work=Spin|title=Dressed to Kill: A Day in the Life of Rising Comedienne Natasha Leggero|author=Marchese, David|date=October 21, 2011|accessdate=October 6, 2017}} She married comedian [[Moshe Kasher]] in 2015.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ya1PW8OHoI4 |title=Natasha Leggero Doesn’t Want To Plan Her Wedding |publisher=YouTube |date=July 29, 2015 |accessdate=August 8, 2015 }}{{cite web|url=http://www.adweek.com/news/television/comedian-natasha-leggero-talks-getting-high-youtube-165455 |title=Comedian Natasha Leggero Talks Getting High on YouTube Plus, the highbrow TV drama that always puts her to sleep |publisher=AdWeek |date=June 23, 2015 |accessdate=August 9, 2015 }} During an October 3, 2017 interview with [[Stephen Colbert]], Leggero announced that she and Kasher were expecting their first child.{{cite web|author=Burford, Corinna|date=October 4, 2017|work=Vulture|url=http://www.vulture.com/2017/10/natasha-leggero-talks-being-pregnant-and-sober-on-colbert.html|title=Natasha Leggero Reveals the Worst Part of Being Pregnant in 2017|accessdate=October 6, 2017}} On February 24, 2018, Leggero announced the birth of their child, a girl, via Instagram.[https://www.instagram.com/p/Bfl9kcpFe2A/?taken-by=natashaleggero Natasha Leggero]. Instagram. Retrieved on February 24, 2018. She resides in Los Angeles, California.{{cite web|work=Variety|date=December 19, 2016|title= Married Comedians Natasha Leggero and Moshe Kasher Lease Out Silver Lake Cottage |author=David, Mark|accessdate=December 28, 2016|url=https://variety.com/2016/dirt/real-estalker/natasha-leggero-moshe-kasher-lease-silver-lake-cottage-1201945412/}} ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" ! Year ! Title ! Role ! class="unsortable" | Notes |- | 2007 | ''The Exorcist Chronicles'' | Leah | |- | 2009 | ''[[He's Just Not That Into You (film)|He's Just Not That Into You]]'' | Amber Gnech | |- | 2013 | ''[[Tome of the Unknown]]'' | Beatrice | Short film; pilot for the miniseries ''[[Over the Garden Wall (miniseries)|Over the Garden Wall]]'' |- | 2013 | ''[[Dealin' with Idiots]]'' | Tipsy Jessica | |- | 2014 |''[[Neighbors (2014 film)|Neighbors]]'' | Street prostitute | |- | 2014 | ''[[Let's Be Cops]]'' | Annie | |- | 2015 | ''[[The Breakup Girl]]'' | Kim | |- | 2015 | ''A Better You'' | Tamara | |- | 2016 | ''[[The Do-Over]]'' | Nikki | |} ===Television=== {| class="wikitable sortable" ! Year ! Title ! episode dated December 8, 2007 |- | 2008–2014 | ''[[Chelsea Lately]]'' | Herself | Guest panelist; various episodes |- | 2008 | ''[[Samantha Who?]]'' | Female Customer | Episode: "The Gallery Show" |- | 2008 | ''[[SuperNews!]]'' | [[Hillary Clinton]] (voice) | Episode: "Super Short" |- | 2008 | ''SuperNews!'' | [[Sarah Palin]] (voice) | Episode: "Top Gov" |- | 2008 | ''{{sortname|The|Sarah Silverman Program}}'' | Dr. Leggero | Episode: "Vow Wow" |- | 2008 | ''[[Worst Week]]'' | Liz | Episode: "The Gift" |- | 2009 | ''[[Aqua Teen Hunger Force]]'' | Computer Technician (voice) | Episode: "[[Fry Legs]]" |- | 2009–2010 | ''{{sortname|The|Smoking Gun Presents: World's Dumbest...}}'' | Herself | Commentator; 28 episodes |- | 2010 | '''Til Death'' | Sandy | Episode: "Snore Loser" |- | 2010–2012 | ''[[Ugly Americans (TV series)|Ugly Americans]]'' | Callie Maggotbone (voice) | Main cast; 31 episodes |- | 2010 | ''[[Last Comic Standing]]'' | Herself | Judge (season 7); 8 episodes |- | 2012 | ''{{sortname|The|Life & Times of Tim}}'' | Female Rodney (voice) | 2 episodes |- | 2012 | ''[[Are You There, Chelsea?]]'' | Nikki Natoli | 6 episodes |- | 2012 | ''[[The Life & Times of Tim]]'' | Female Rodney (voice) | 2 episodes |- | 2012 | ''[[China, IL]]'' | Jen (voice) | Episode: "Frankensteve" |- | 2012 | ''[[Regular Show]]'' | LaDonna / Girl in Line (voice) | Episode: "Access Denied" |- | 2012–2013 | ''{{sortname|The|Burn with Jeff Ross}}'' | Herself | 2 episodes |- | 2012 | ''[[NTSF:SD:SUV::]]'' | Mona Lisa | Episode: "Time Angels" |- | 2013–2015 | ''[[Brickleberry]]'' | Ethel (voice) | Main cast (season 2–season 3) |- | 2013 | ''[[Whitney (TV series)|Whitney]]'' | Danielle | Episode: "Lost in Transition" |- | 2013 | ''[[The Jeselnik Offensive]]'' | Panelist | 1 episode |- | 2013 | ''[[Community (TV series)|Community]]'' | Mysti | Episode: "[[Heroic Origins]]" |- | 2013 | ''[[Ghost Ghirls]]'' | Sissy | Episode: "Hooker With A Heart of Ghoul" |- | 2013 | ''[[Arrested Development (TV series)|Arrested Development]]'' | Jackie | Episode: "[[Borderline Personalities]]" |- | 2013 | ''[[Drunk History]]'' | Herself | Narrator; Moving Co.]]'' | Natasha (voice) | 3 episodes |- | 2013 | ''[[Key & Peele]]'' | White Woman #2 | Episode: "The Power of Wings" |- | 2013 | ''{{sortname|The|Birthday Boys|dab=TV series}}'' | Superintendent | Episode: "Going All the Way" |- | 2014 | ''[[Suburgatory]]'' | Nora | 4 episodes |- | 2014 | ''[[Inside Amy Schumer]]'' | Mia | Episode: "Slut-Shaming" |- | 2014 | ''[[Clarence (2014 TV series)|Clarence]]'' | Nature Kate / Heida (voice) | Episode: "Nature Clarence" |- | 2014 | ''[[Garfunkel & Oates (TV series)|Garfunkel & Oates]]'' | Vivian | 3 episodes: "The Fadeaway", "Eggs" and "Maturity". |- | 2015 | ''[[Marry Me (U.S. TV series)|Marry Me]]'' | Laguna Matata | Episode: "Spoil Me" |- | 2015 | ''[[Mulaney]]'' | Rodeo | Episode: "Life is a Series of Different Apartments" |- | 2015–present | ''[[Another Period]]'' | Lillian Bellacourt | Main cast; also creator |- | 2015 | ''[[Modern Family]]'' | Dana | Episode: "[[Fight or Flight (Modern Family)|Fight or Flight]]" |- | 2015 | ''[[The Comedy Central Roast of Justin Bieber]]'' | Herself | One night [[television special]] |- | 2015 | ''Drunk History'' | [[Elizabeth Bisland]] | Episode: "Journalism" |- | 2016 | ''[[Superstore (TV series)|Superstore]]'' | Shoplifter | Episode: "Shoplifter" |- | 2016–2017 | ''[[Dice (TV series)|Dice]]'' | Carmen | 13 episodes |- | 2016–2017 | ''[[American Dad!]]'' | Planet Hollywood Waitress / Karen (voice) | 2 episodes |- | 2016 | ''[[BoJack Horseman]]'' | Heather (voice) | Episode: "Start Spreading the News" |- | 2017 | ''[[Justice League Action]]'' | [[Poison Ivy (character)|Poison Ivy]] | Episode: "Garden of Evil" |} ===Web=== {| class="wikitable sortable" ! Year ! Title ! Role ! class="unsortable" | Notes |- | 2006 | ''Fire Guys'' | Black Ladder Team leader | Episode 3 |- | 2012–2013 | ''[[Burning Love (web series)|Burning Love]]'' | Haley | 14 episodes |- | 2012 | ''Escape My Life'' | Skylar Browning | 8 episodes |- | 2013 | ''Tubbin' with Tash'' | Herself | Series creator and star |- | 2015 | ''Joe Rogan Experience'' | Herself | Podcast Episode 653 |- | 2015 | ''The Adam Carolla Show'' | Herself | Podcast May 31 |- | 2015 | ''Limbo'' | Lucy / Lucifer | Independent short film |- | 2016 | ''[[WTF with Marc Maron]]'' | Herself | Episode 707 |} ==Discography== * ''Coke Money'' (2011) * ''Live at Bimbo's'' (2015) ==Notes== {{Noteslist}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Commonscat|Natasha Leggero}} * {{Official website|http://www.natashaleggero.com}} * {{IMDb name|1641089}} {{portalbar|Comedy|Illinois}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Leggero, Natasha}} [[Category:1974 births]] [[Category:21st-century American actresses]] [[Category:Converts to Judaism from Roman Catholicism]] [[Category:Actresses from Illinois]] [[Category:American film actresses]] [[Category:American people of Italian descent]] [[Category:American people of Swedish descent]] [[Category:American stand-up comedians]] [[Category:American television actresses]] [[Category:American voice actresses]] [[Category:American women comedians]] [[Category:Hunter College alumni]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Actors from Rockford, Illinois]] [[Category:Actresses of Italian descent]] [[Category:Stella Adler Studio of Acting alumni]] [[Category:Comedians from Illinois]] [[Category:Jewish American actresses]] [[Category:Jewish American comedians]] [[Category:21st-century American comedians]]
